title: Freewave + Evdog - Crystal
description:
Ok first things first. This is a ponified cover of a New Order song. One of my favorite alternative dance bands and a track that instantly came to mind when i saw the Crystal Empire 2 parter (and one that didn't need a lot of lyric changing tbh). This has been delayed a bit until i got a vocalist and Evdog came through this last week and put some wonderful vocals on this track. Glad we finally got to work on something new together and there's more collabs to come between us. I did the rest of the music in a style of breakbeats but with a mix of shoegaze and electro. This track speaks to me in terms of how fragile we are as people (especially after the Connecticut tragedy) and also from pov of the crystal ponies who were both enslaved and forgotten (again, actually heavy stuff). Luckily i think love conquers all, even outside of Equestria. Anyway this is my last dark track for awhile and the next one should be a fun jazz-funk track.

I hope you enjoy this pmv and track (see the lyrics on the youtube)
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BODQP-TNP9Y

Evdog's youtube is http://www.youtube.com/user/EvdogMusic

title: Celestial

It's about time I made a Celestia track, isn't it? Well, I finally did ^.^

 This track is themed around Celestia, so I tried to get a vision of her power, wisdom and grace all at once(It was certainly a challenge for me) In the end, I got this, and I feel like I hit at least two of those points I wanted to hit, so It came out pretty good ^.^

Stay awesome, and I hope to entertain =D

I'm sure this could have used a little time and polish but i did my best with a 3 day time frame to do this (2 very late nights on a work week). title: And The Rainfall - The Romantic Tragedy (feat. Freewave)
description:
Why did we not upload this weeks ago? Anyways, my goodness this has been such a long project but it's also been a joy to work on with my great friend ATR. He has been such a rock to me and helped me through so many highs and lows since we both started making brony music. It's just been eye-opening to me on this project how FREAKING talented he is and how much work and layers he puts into a single track such as this. Again despite just the amazing learning experience of this track, it's really the great friendship we've built that is best takeaway.

Video is here on ATR's ytube http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xF-IIW9dvuo

title: A touch of dedication
description:
Enjoy your christmas present :D :D Yes I'm a cheap bastard

Something that's been a project since March, so that's, 9 months now? Don't think it's anything great though, it's, however, catchy, and I was going for a very dynamic feeling, and I'm happy I didn't brickwall this so it is kinda dynamic both in the mixing kind of sense and in the melodies kind of sense, I guess :D

I love this pic; recently found it, really cool! Kinda gets you in the mood to listen. I wonder who plays all the other violins and cellos in all these Octavia songs :S

As you can tell, this one is fairly simmilar to A touch of variation, with which I was planning to do a, sort of, collection of songs around Octavia, hence why this was started in March, and worked on troughout the year. Maybe I'll make some kind of a free Octavia EP in the future with similar songs, if you like them :) Encourage me, I'm lazy xD Or not, if it's horrible :D

Anyways, merry Christmas to all the Catholic folk, Happy Holidays for the rest of us, and may the force be with us.

title: Dethurge
description:
[800-Subscribers-Special!] 
This is the title-track for my MLP Metal Album: Dethurge 
Thank you all so very much for the support! 

This song has been under works, and under the rug, for about 2 years now, if not more.
It's the first song I ever composed and it was just meant as a practice song for Guitar Hero; with medium fast solos and a fun riff in between. 
However, I later on wanted to make something more with it. So I added more parts, instruments and bunch of other stuff like time signature changes. Basically made it more progressive. 

BPM: 190
Time Signatures: 4/4, 7/8, 15/8, 9/8

The song is about the battle between Pinkie Pie and her darker side; Pinkamena, who takes over her body and mind. I'm not going to explain too much since it's more fun if you try to figure out yourself what's going on.

title: Cutie Appleblues (Broken Lessons)
description:
This cutecore synth rock song is dedicated to NotClev, since parts of the song sound like his song (nice catch, BronyMike, clever guy! Gonna get you a gift for that hahaha)

Special thanks:
Cats Millionaire - Advisement
Triangle Brony, Mitchell the Pony - Critique 

Everyday you
find a way to
try something new
while staying true
hearing Applebloom's
cutie appleblues
heavy tears and sighs
losing grip, she cries.
Hoping magic brews
could cure appleblues
she put aside friends
to make sadness end.
This ain't what she wanted
but the lesson must be learned
even when you're down and out
progress isn't quickly earned.
When you get back on the horse
you will have to reinspire
dig deep and remember to
reignite your fire.
Dear Princess Celestia, my broken lesson of the week
is that you must learn to encourage yourself when you feel
helpless. Scootaloo and Sweetie Belle were good friends to
try cheering Applebloom up, but it's something she had to
learn to do on her own. Every fire can be reignited.
Short term gain and
impulse acts land
you in quicksand
so understand
even though you think
your plan's out of sync
running without stride
you must learn to bide
/chorus

title: Colortwelve - Migration (Soupcan Remix)
description:
just a little side note:

This song is mainly an experimental song.

The mixing in it is not perfect, and it’s not meant to be. For this song, I kind of wanted the mixing to be… Different. My goal here was not to make everything super clear, or super mushed. It’s actually really hard to explain what I wanted to go for with it, but um, yeah.

It sounds weird saying that, and it is. I don’t know why I wanted it like this, but something just told me I had to do it this way.

ALSO, you might notice a slight little part or two in the piano where something goes off note, or a quick pause in the piano so it sounds sort of like someone messing up. That was completely intentional. Having actually played piano, I know it’s pretty hard to avoid error, especially when something is over 4 minutes long, so I added a couple subtle errors in there to make it feel a bit more… Real.

In other words, it’s not meant to be perfect at all. You might love it, you might hate it.

Art: http://assasinmonkey.deviantart.com/art/Skies-of-Fires-322743842

ABOUT "SIX" ALBUM

Cover art made by 30 Colored Owl
http://fav.me/d56d95u

Concept of that album came to me after I finished "Everypony's World". I was planning to make an album with a track dedicated to all Mane6 characters. But somehow I wasn't able to finish it as fast as I wanted to. Seriously, I was planning to finish Six before Spring... But my I-DE-AS are different. Finally that project come to an end. And... I'm so glad I made it. 

Tracklist isn't random. I set the tunes in order we met our Mane6 ponies. From Twilight Sparkle to Pinkie Pie (for me Twilie and Pinkie first met when PP made a party for her). And for these who will download the whole album, there will be also a hi-res bonus - old version of Magic is Powerful.

And this one is a chillout and calm track about AJ resting under an apple tree and watching her farm.

So... enjoy with them and let me know what are you thinking about the track and whole album in comments!

One Youtube search for 'Michael Jackson Bad Hip-Hop Remix' later... I arrive on this beat.  The rest is history.

title: Easy As A Mirror Pool (with Eccentrifuge)
description:
Missing the things you came here for
Hoping for - a miracle - to show us
- there's more to us than this experience -
Are we adrift in life? - able to see -
only the things that cross our gulf stream, our ocean current?
Can’t I just be there? Can you? How will you decide where you’re going

[refrain] Calling out your name
Trying to find you
There's no one to blame
Oh
You are not the same
You are the only one
who put this friendship first
We love you

Have you too little time - or just too much to think
You're the one who picks us up, we should've done something
If you could be more places at once, what would that mean for us?
You'd be there for your friends but would it be the one we trust?
I don't know if you realize how powerful you are
Let life happen, it will change you in ways you could never know
You say you like surprises but you can't stand letting go
You'll never be left behind, so don't worry
Your friends are here and now, what’s the hurry?

You gotta think before you act , if you don’t - you might wish you could take it all back -
The more energy you subtract, the more work it will take for you to recharge, as a matter of fact -
Give a little thought to ponies that sing differently, there is no symmetry here without sympathy
You’ve got to be - reminded who this effort is directed to and find a way to let your friends finally relax
Breathe - a line behind the shapes we can percieve, to actualize everything we believe
See - observe the scene with your keen intellect the thread that ties everything we are hoping to be
We ponies are like a tree, the words we say are just leaves - Be flattened to the ground by a breeze, but we’ll always
be connected to the source of our unity - don’t let it go, it’s part of what it means to be
- The common wisdom's nothing's easy as Pie, but it's genuinely hard sometimes - some
times there are things that just trouble her mind, - so she finds escape hidden in old rhymes - You should
remember something: there's a difference between breaking a record and having a good time - but I
wonder if there's anyone who doesn't break down, - please don't frown, it'll be just fine
Given a difference between a difficult choice - and another decision equally hard to make
There’s a point when you have to let it all go and be present in the moment, no mistake
Lyrics lyrics lyrics lyrics lyrics, lyrics lyrics lyrics, more lyrics, oh god

title: End of the Line
description:
YOUTUBE: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Coc6D5ukAyo
SOUNDCLOUD: https://soundcloud.com/zackthekajillionth/end-of-the-line
INSTRUMENTAL: https://soundcloud.com/zackthekajillionth/end-of-the-line-instrumental

This fandom's been missing some slow, sludgy heavy metal. So I made some of my own!

My favorite part of the MLP universe is the story of the Royal Sisters. There's a sense of... humanity and emotion that really doesn't show in a lot of mythology. I wanted to capture the feeling of being trapped on the moon for a thousand years - that weird mixture of pain and anger and sorrow and defeat that blurs the line between Luna and Nightmare Moon.

Anyway, hope you all enjoy!

LYRICS:

I can't pretend what I touch is gold
So I took a chance and I sold my soul
It's not hard to dream, it's hard to let go
Dear sister left me, now I'm alone

And in this desperate time I'm a sinner
And in this world of mine, where moonlight shines
It's the end of the line

One thousand years in the dark and cold
This pain is young, my soul is old

'Cause in this desperate time I'm a sinner
And in this world of mine, where moonlight shines
It's the end of the line

And oh, dear sister mine - can't forgive her
I've got my hate but it never withers
'Cause in this desperate time I'm a sinner
And in this world of mine, where moonlight shines
It's the end of the line

title: in our town( swagg brony mix)
snapshot Jul 12
description:
from Accrued Pony Music
http://soundsfromsci.bandcamp.com/album/accrued-pony-music

accompanying this song was the following (sappy) text:

The first track from Accrued Pony Music.

It’s a special track to me, because it basically encompasses my thoughts on the FiM fandom, especially after having been to bronycon. 
friends come and go, but they never really stop being friends. they just kind of fall out of contact. this happens a lot. 
Just because I don’t talk to the many of the great people I met during my stay in the fandom doesn’t mean any ill feelings were harbored. There’s just a physical space between us. A transversable space. 
But there’s still a pretty amazing circle of friends that I hang out with (almost) daily. 
These are great people. 
Watching MLP did not change my life. Instead, it introduced me to all of these amazing people. 
They are the ones that changed my life. 
I love my friends.

title: I've Got to Find a Way (Metal Cover)
description:
I've been meaning to do this track for months. I had originally planned on tracking this sometime in the early spring, but I had an OverClocked ReMix album to finish, which ended up taking way more out of my personal time than I had originally planned. Thankfully, I have a break in handling the logistics of that massive undertaking to get this finished.

I knew right when I heard this track that its minor key and tone would translate really well into metal, and immediately had ideas for much of the track. They didn't get out until months later, but as they did, more ideas formed. This may be the best use I've gotten out of Pitcher; I've learned a lot about that VST, and was able to make a pretty convincing backing harmony track for this (still <3 ya though, Corralfur). The melodies sound fantastic when put to the amp as well. Overall, this was a really fun track to make.

This release personally represents a major shift for me in terms of my outlook on the brony fandom. A lot has happened between when I released my "Winter Wrap-Up" cover and this track. The biggest factor in how I've come to view the fandom wasn't all the bad I saw in the fandom during that time (especially what I saw recently in what I thought was the last little bit of good left in the fandom), but rather how fulfilling "Gunstar Heroes: Be Aggressive!" has been. I realized that I was wasting my time attempting to fix the brony music scene, using efforts like Brony Music Spotlight and pushing heavily for a judge-based artist/music featuring system on Pony.fm, when it was apparent from the major sites' insistence on pushing mediocrity and stifling talent and the mindless drones' willingness to drink that mediocrity up in huge quantities that the brony music scene simply doesn't want to be fixed. Meanwhile, all the time and effort I've put into my dealings at OverClocked ReMix have been respected quite a bit, and the album isn't even out yet!

So this track, like all future pony covers that I'll make, isn't made for the masses. It isn't made for recognition, or e-fame, or even respect by other brony musicians in the community. I didn't submit it to Equestria Daily so it could be rejected by Sethisto, being a whiney child who can't take criticism while protecting his "all-star" regulars from guys like me that blow them out of the water. And I can't submit it to Everfree Radio because I'm banned for making things too convenient, but even if I weren't, I wouldn't sub it there anyway to watch the bronypop influence show just how prominent it is. I made this track fully aware that, despite it being some of the best brony metal you will ever hear, and likely the only cover of this song uploaded anywhere on the Internet that actually does the source true metal justice, I will never reach a level of recognition that so many with lesser talent have managed to achieve simply because they were "here" first.

No, I did this for me, for the same reason I started doing MLP metal covers in the first place: I wanted to challenge myself in a unique way and make what I can't hear anywhere else on the Internet; high quality metal covers of songs from this amazing show. And if you like my music, I did this for you too, and I thank you immensely, both for your support, and for not being part of a problem that was simply too big for me to fix.

Vocals by Rebecca Shoichet (show audio rip).

description:

This was an entry for "Remix War 5: United Media Makers" which allowed originals, provided they had a fic, art, and a video to go with it. Only 5 people entered >:U, and I was the only person to take up that challenge.

Art By
Moon: http://moonsango.deviantart.com

ScootaLewis: http://www.youtube.com/user/ScootaLewis
Synthy Shy: http://www.youtube.com/user/FLUTTERSHYVERYSHY
SpaceKing: http://www.youtube.com/user/SpaceKingofSpace

Wolf Guardian's "Storm of Secrets": http://www.fimfiction.net/story/60626/storm-of-secrets-remastered

Here are some words from Wolf Guardian himself:
Spoiler  Spoiler  Spoiler
The Everfree Forest is the homeland of the changelings and a race of telepathic monsters called terrormongers who feed on fear and can conjure hallucinations. They read your mind, then start creating illusions designed to scare you. As you become more afraid, they feed off that fear and use it to make the illusions worse and worse until you die. They can also use their illusions to enslave wild beasts. Both species are trying to invade Equestria, but are being kept at bay by a secret army called the Everfree Rangers. The war needs to be kept secret because if it became public knowledge, there could be a mass panic, strengthening the terrormongers, enabling them to destroy Equestria. Shining Armor is one of the Rangers, and through somewhat complicated circumstances goes on an emergency mission into the forest with Twilight and Rainbow Dash. When they're camping on the first night, Shining Armor tells them the story of Denorious:
Denorious was a pegasus Ranger with a silver coat, golden mane and a cutie mark of a ray of light breaking through black storm clouds. Shining Armor says she was the fastest Pegasus ever recorded, which Rainbow Dash disputes, but then it turns out Denorious was at least 20% faster, (probably more like 40%,) making Rainbow Dash extremely jealous. Twilight tries to cheer her up, but then finds out Denorious had an IQ 13 points higher then hers, making Twilight extremely jealous. Shining Armor then goes on about how Denorious was a legendary tactician, who could inspire hope in any circumstance, that she was incredibly beautiful and how most of the Ranger stallions had a crush on her.
Denorious began as a Jr. Sheriff in Manehatten. After annihilating a massive crime ring; Denorious was flooded with offers of promotion and Celestia offered to take her as her personal protege, but refused them and instead became a Ranger, believing it was the best way she could serve others. Denorious shot through the Ranger ranks; and eventually defeated an Ursa Major in single combat, saved Equestria and became leader of the Rangers. (The point this song was theoretically written.)
Spoiler!  Spoiler!  Spoiler!
For a short time the Rangers are advancing, but eventually Denorious is captured by the terrormongers, who savagely torture her. By the time she's rescued, the terrormongers have destroyed her memories and replaced them with several hundred years of false memories where she can do nothing but watch, and blame herself, as all life in the world dies agonizing deaths, only to be resurrected over and over so they can die even more horribly. Denorious suffered irrevocable neurological damage, severe brain damage and had tried to gouge out one of her own eyes in a futile effort to stop the images.
The Rangers race Denorious to Celestia, who manages to partially heal her eye, but can't do anything to restore her mind. The only thing Celestia can offer is a memory block which will give her complete amnesia and make her cutie mark disappear. The block is going to be weak, however, meaning that if Denorious ever sees any of the Rangers, hears any of their voices, or learns anything about the war or her past life; all the false memories could come flooding back in an instant, permanently destroying her mind.
The Rangers hate this, but are forced to swear an oath never to contact Denorious for any reason. Many Rangers, however, still refuse to believe Denorious is truly gone and say that she will return to lead them in their hour of greatest need.
The last thing that Shining Armor ever heard of Denorious, was that she had become a mail-mare in a small town and began calling herself Derpy.
Then Rainbow Dash has eleven heart attacks in a row, and Twilight's head blows up.
(Note: this is a side story; I haven't given away much of the main plot.)

title: End of the Fandom As We Know It
description:
Okay, this isn't a serious song, but it's also not a troll.

This is for the S3 Finale Synopsis TB compilation. I figured since there is such a huge and overly dramatic reaction, why not make a parody song that draws a musical picture of the situation.

Yes, I openly admit that the vocals BLOW. Keep in mind, this was rushed because of schedule conflicts and my voice was completely shot by the time the vocal track was finished (mainly due to a huge number of failed takes and a horrible sinus infection that I was going through).

However, this song was meant to be laughed with or at. You choose.

Lyrics:

That's weird it starts with a teaser, rough sketches, and spoilers. M.A. Larson is not afraid.
Eye of the flamestorm, watch as the world burns, fans serve their own needs, staring in disbelief, kick it up a notch please, love no, flame with, boards such a clutter with fear fights - sad sights

Afire and conspire, the theories all the same, all of ponychan becomes a combat sight.

Videos being banned in a hurry with Hasbro breathing down you neck.

Two by two, bronies baffled from all the hype. Look at that new plot! Oh...well...

Uh oh, there they go, fears too common for the bronies to save thierself, hide yourself from all the world greed Hasbro wants to breed, Celestia coming  with the Rapture in her flight, right?

You whine about it, cry about it, i'm-right-hype-gripe, fillies fall aside.

It's the end of the fandom as we know it (3x)
And I could cry~


Saturday, Pony hour, heart attack for an hour, not what you want in turn, watch as the plot turns, looking for the alicorn, hope burning for magic, quickly to escalate, episode-incenerate. Why did Lauren Faust have to step down, step down? The fandom is crushed, crushed.

Uh oh, this means they're here, troll fears, from the rear, steer clear - a trolling, a trolling, a tolling of lies! Littlest Pet Shop as an alternative, but I decline.

It's the end of the fandom as we know it (multiple times)
And I could cry~



The others fight, drift alike, but love is really nice, what about all the hype? Friendship survives! Remember that, scratch that, what about Pinkie's Party that time, just like a Sonic Rainboom

We'll rise above it, gotta love it, we're still friends... right? RIGHT!

It's the end of the fandom as we know it (3x)
And I could cry~

title: "Leave Me Alone" - Evdog & Meelz
description:
Being the Lord of Chaos must get pretty lonely sometimes...
Stems Available here: https://www.dropbox.com/s/c7tmyto2d8evnjv/stems%20320.zip 

This was entered into Toastbeard, round ER310, and tied for 1st.
Evdog - Arrangement, Vocals
Meelz - Production, Guitar

LYRICS
VERSE 1:
You always trying to assert yourself over me
Always holding me back from becoming who I want to be
You don't seem to understand that I'm the one who runs this show. Oh no.
Well, it's time for you to understand and learn your place or you can pack up your things and go

CHORUS 1:
Just Leave me alone. Get out of my head, get out of my life
But don't go too long. I didn't mean it, I need somebody
I can't stand being alone.

VERSE 2:
Oh, why did it take me forever to realize I was wrong
Don't you know that in each other's arms is where both belong.
I want you. I need you. I don't know how I'd live without you. It's true
Please come back. I'm sorry. I mean it this time. I know we can both pull through.

CHORUS 1 x2, THEN GUITAR SOLO

BRIDGE:
And I can't understand why you're forcing my hand.
Why I hate you and love you on your demand.
Or maybe it's me. I wanna be free.
Look inside my eyes, I'm pleading: Please help me.

CHORUS 2:
Don't leave me alone. Stay by my side. Please hold on tight.
Until the break of dawn. But it won't last forever. ever. ever. ever. ever, yeah!

CHORUS 1 x2, THEN OVERLAPPED LYRIC SECTION

title: Berryway
description:
Here's an original track for my other best pony, Cherry Berry. This is actually a rather dark song. It's based off some of my personal issues, which I also imagine Cherry Berry to have.

I trot through life with no
clear ending in my sight
The present and now of today
Is all that keeps me true to my light

Grab a cherry, go feel merry
This food's meant for more than one
The path to all our hopes and dreams have
Only just begun

Come dica nonna mia
Bella Vità, dole Vità
Come dica mamma mia

Seems like everyday your face is
Murked with anxiety
Frowns of stone, all alone
Seeking for one small remedy
Life's short, fly up in my balloon and realise
That joy's a rare prize
So share it now before you go
To those who seek to sympathise, to know you

title: Birthday: 18
description: A "Make A Wish" inspired Instrumental released on my 18th birthday.

title: The Artist
description:
Stems are here, if you're feeling creative: http://www.mediafire.com/?u06lgdtclot9d

Quote by Ira Glass: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ira_Glass
As for the songs playing with the quote, one's by Wooden Toaster, one's by Aviators, one's by Matthew Mosier, and one's by me. Now go exploring. :P

LYRICS:
Verse 1:
There's a part of you that wants to demonstrate what beauty is,
And you want to reveal the parts of life that people rarely glimpse,
But the world greets you with a slap to the face, and an industry with narrow tastes,
And you wonder if your voice will be heard at all.

Chorus:
You try each day to better yourself, but you never make it, you don't make it.
You throw away all your older work, because it reminds you  of who you'll never be
You look at all of the other guys who make is so easy, they make it so easy.
You lie awake at night wondering if you're even half as good as everyone knows that you are.

Verse 2:
You wonder why you're failing: why you just can't scale this wall,
And you start to really wonder why you ever followed this call,
But that core of love, it still remains and it's naggin' at your heart.
That desire inside you's the first love that brought you to be here at the start.

Quote by Ira Glass: http://www.goodreads.com/quotes/309485-nobody-tells-this-to-people-who-are-beginners-i-wish

Bridge:
You can make it easier on yourself if you understand we all feel the same way you do.
Even those you look up to; Even those who look up to you.

title: Flying Free (Ft. FIMProv)
description:
Description, lyrics, and download below~

This was a really fun song I finished with one of my good friends. We're a little guilty of some minor shipping, but y'know, a party pony with a shy lover is just too adorable!

Lyrics

FLYING FREE
Lyrics by FIMprov

[Verse 1]
Before I met you, I thought that I
Would never feel alive,
Had nopony to be there,
Needed somepony who would care

(Care) to tell me why it’s me,
Why it’s me you came to see?
I can hardly speak at all,
Won’t you catch me if I fall?

[Rap]
(Fall)ing in love is a wonderful thing,
They say that it can make your heart sing
But I just can't see
How we could ever be
If I can’t even make myself speak

You know I just can’t open up my mouth
My eyes just end up looking south
I find myself staring at the floor
I'm afraid I can't handle anything more

Than friendship. Show me love so true,
I’ll never look at any other pony but you.
All I need is just one reason
To convince me that I need ya.

Teach me how to open up,
Teach me how to fall in love,
And never again will I ever doubt,
That you’re the one I can’t live without.

[Chorus]
Flying free
Who would have thought that you and I could ever be?
It's all thanks to you that I can open up and see.
When we're together
No matter the weather
I feel like I'm free
It's all thanks to you, Pinkie.

[Verse 2]
I can fly free
When you're with me (x2)

-Solo-

[Chorus]

title: Allies With Lightning
description:
My first song done for Toastbeard. It was definitely fun to do and pretty rewarding. Glad I did it.

Copypasta: "Alright, got this done with. I decided to go more for the progression of the mood of the episode instead of a specific theme or character. It starts off with Dash and the other waiting for the letter, and in the same area, Dash's travel and welcoming to the academy. It's light-hearted, soft, and generally airy with just a hint of punch. The next movement is her beginning training, specifically with Lightning Dust. It picks up quite a bit of speed, lots of movement and different things going on, and drums to demonstrate both Dash's and Dust's hard-hitting attitudes. The next section is when the tornado starts stirring about, nearly killing Dash's friends and where Dash decides she might just quit the team. It's a darker part of the episode, and in a way, kind of intense. Finally, it ends with Dash being accepted back into the Academy, the training continuing, and everything in general turning out alright.

Please interpret any part as you wish, though. These were merely my initial intentions."

Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/nulrei/allies-with-lightning

title: Dear Sister Moon
description:
The other side of the "End of the Line" story: I imagined a Celestia haunted by loneliness and regret - she can't come to terms with Luna's transformation and banishment, so she reaches out to this imaginary Luna; a sweet, innocent, and forgiving Luna who helps her cope and sleep through the night.

LYRICS:
Now as I lay me
Down to sleep
I pray thee, Dear Sister Moon
My soul to keep

And if you should leave me
Before I wake
I pray thee, Dear Sister Moon
My heart to take

So lend me sweet dreams
Through the night
And wake me, Dear Sister Moon
For morning light

So guide me safely
Through future days
I pray thee, Dear Sister Moon
I pray

Now as I lay me
Down to sleep
I pray thee, Dear Sister Moon
My soul to keep

So grant me sweet dreams
To last the night
Oh, grant me, Dear Sister Moon...

I dream of stars
I dream of night
I dream a thousand winters gone and open my eyes
I dream of home
I dream of light
I dream these thousand winters gone
And open my eyes...

So guide me safely
Through future days
I pray thee, Dear Sister Moon
To you I pray

For if you should leave me
Before I wake
I pray thee, Dear Sister Moon...

I dream of stars
I dream of night
I dream a thousand winters gone and open my eyes
I dream of home
I dream light
I dream these thousand winters gone...
I dream of stars
I dream of night
I dream a thousand winters gone and open my eyes
I dream of home
I dream light
I dream a thousand winters gone
And open my eyes...

title: Broken Mirror Pond (Vocal Mix)
description:
A fun song I did for the TLK album you can find here: http://thelesserknowns.bandcamp.com/album/the-lesser-knowns-vol-3

Definitely a super fun song to do in general, and I'm glad I was able to work with an awesome vocalist such as Bludolph!



Lyrics

Where the brambles are thickest, there you will find, a pond beyond the most twisted of vines!
And into her own reflection she stared, yearning for one whose reflection she shared,
And solemnly sweared not to be scared, at the prospect of being doubly mared!
So the mare did happily say, until her day was twisted every which way.

Ooooone, one too little thoughts for around the bend
One too little thoughts for the end
Ooooone, one too many bodies that you call your own
Ooooone, one too many bodies that you call your clone, clone, clone

You’re stuck among your own crowd
Living under your own massive shroud
How can you stick out without being loud?
And be with your friends that you’ve been endowed

A shadoooow, under a shadow of your kind
And one with a colony, with the rest entwined
You lose feeling of individuality
The Pinkies reaching plurality

Where the brambles are thickest, there you will find, a pond beyond the most twisted of vines!
And into her own reflection she stared, yearning for one whose reflection she shared,
And solemnly sweared not to be scared, at the prospect of being doubly mared!
So the mare did happily say, until her day was twisted every which way.

title: My Equestria [acoustic/vocal ballad]
description:
(from "Isle of Inisfree" – by Richard Farrelly, ©1950)
Vocals & Equestria lyrics by Dreamsong
Flute and instrumentation by Dreamsong

For some reason, for the last little while... I've been feeling... "Homesick"... ...for Equestria.

I can't really explain it... but that doesn't make the feelings any less real.

So, when I heard "Isle of Inisfree," a Celtic song about a displaced soul longing for their home... I knew just had to rewrite it to match how I was feeling.

If you've ever felt this too... I hope this song makes the longing a little easier knowing that there are others who feel it as well.


------------------------

I've met some folks who say that I'm a dreamer,
And I've no doubt there's truth in what they say,
But sure a body's bound to be a dreamer,
When all the things she loves are far away.
And precious things are dreams unto an exile.
They bring her home to a land so magical
And in her heart she's once again pony,
In her dear lovely home, Equestria.

When this world's moon rises beyond the rooftops,
Of this great city, with wonders near and far,
I scarcely feel the bright lights or the turmoil...
I'm home again in my Equestria.

I wander o'er green hills through dreamy valleys,
And find a peace no other land would know.
I hear the birds make music fit for angels,
And watch the rivers laughing as they flow.
And back to Ponyville my hooves they take me,
My dear old home and tenderly behold,
Ponies I love around the village, gathered.
And I relive their friendships young and old.

But dreams don't last
Though friends are not forgotten
And soon I'm back to harsh reality.
But even if they paved the roads with gold here,
I still would choose my dear Equestria.

title: Harvest Time song from Moonbeam fanfic
description:
My rendition of the song described in Chapter 7 “Harvest Time” of the fanfiction [i]Moonbeam[/i] written by Laurence Brown. Read the chapter: http://www.fimfiction.net/story/9767/7/moonbeam/harvest-time .

For context, start reading at “The next few hours, chatter was at a minimum”, about 80% into the chapter. Play this music starting at the words “Pinkie Pie started to hum a tune”, and ending at “Everyone finished together.”

[i]Moonbeam[/i] provided the lyrics and structure of the song. I made up the tune, sang every voice part, and wrote the backing tracks. The production of the song is amateurish, but hopefully at least the song goes well with the description of the song in the story.

I recorded this because of a comment on the chapter asking what tune the song sould be sung to. I decided to share the tune that I had made up. At first, I recorded a simpler, sloppier version of the song. I finished that in 40 minutes, right after which my audio recording program crashed and I lost my work. Then I made this better version in 2 hours using GarageBand. I know some parts would be better after re-recording, but the current version is good enough for me.

title: Re-Elevate & Remember
description:
And... here we are.  

It hasn't been a year yet, and I am honored to bring you a song to celebrate a number of subs I still really haven't grasped.  In truth this number is irrelevant.  You've all been very important to me since subscriber 1.  But it's important to at least gauge where we started, and where we're at right now.

My good friend Koroshi-ya was right... you can have thousands of subs... but if you hardly get any views when you send something out (that doesn't get EQD), it shows the quality of the people that follow you.

When songs like "Keep Calm Daddy-O" and my Christmas song have 400-500 views... it really makes me smile.  even if 100 of you are listening to them 4-5 times...  it means a ton to me.  I would take that over 1000 people viewing it once... and then moving on with their lives... XD

I'm going to try very hard this year to bring you more music.  More collaborations... and work my hooves off to bring my lyrics and delivery to more of you who haven't heard me yet.

This year I'm going to BronyCon to perform live for the first time.  If that's a success... I'm going to start performing at future cons.

Expect a MASSIVE compilation album (I.Am.Rhyme.Flow) out in the next month that has ALL of my EQD Featured Songs from 2012 to go on sale in Band Camp.

Finally, some notes on this song... Buffalo came to me with the original collaboration idea.  I think I coined the name 'Elevation', and we wrote about our origin stories... and about how aspiring rappers should keep their head up and keep elevating their skills.  I always come back to these lyrics for inspiration and to see my own origins.  But the alternate meaning of Re-Elevate & Remember is to take a step back from this sometimes over-sized and stressful community and really try to think on why we do what we do.

It's a look back on 2010, when this fandom was just getting off the ground and guys were writing music for it... because they WANTED to.  They knew they were a minority, and weren't looking for recognition.  They just loved a show so much that they were INSPIRED TO CREATE MUSIC FOR IT.

So remember why you love this show, and with that feeling: re-elevate yourself.  

Get THIS song for free at:

 
Donate if you'd like!  Every dollar gets me one step closer to Baltimore! 
http://flowny.bandcamp.com/track/re-elevate-remember

TL:DR - Thanks for the 1k subs. Let's keep going. 

Original Beat & Chrous: Do You Remember by Jay Sean ft. Sean Paul & Lil' Jon 
Visualizer by VINXIS 
https://www.youtube.com/user/OYKXF
MC Flowny's New Cutie Mark by Tali Togisala

title: Enya - Epona's Maidens (Likonan Cover) (Stargate: Equestria Music)
description:
Finally another track for Stargate: Equestria. -O-
Credit once again to Bosstone for the awesome fanfic:
http://www.equestriadaily.com/2011/05/story-stargate-equestria.html

The original track is by Enya, from her album "The Celts":
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b8U90UTgJdA

Orchestral by Lt_Andrei
Vocals by Likonan

LYRICS:
The Dark Times were fraught
With what Discord wrought
In the magical land of Equestria
Trees rained down corns
And ponds stirred up storms
Ponies turned on each other in every way known

Equōrum Domina, our kindly Epona
Had grieved for her mares and her geldings
To break his foul spell, two maidens pledged well
To acquire the wisdoms of true hearts and feelings

Elder Celestia of sun's lasting shine
And younger Luna of eternal night
With powers bestowed by Epona's might so divine
They set out to restore both wrong and right

Trickster was bound, made to hear the decree
To break him thrice for his cruel misdeed
The devil with hands, refused their demands
And ensnared the two with his pure malice and greed

The trees shook, the skies cracked
From Discord's taunts' impact
Yet nothing could bring down the sisters with fear
With Harmony at their side, Discord met his demise
Marriage to marble and rock so austere

The dark times were gone, Draconequi moved on
In the magical land of Equestria
Harmony-laden, were Lady's fair maidens
Who nurtured and cared for the land we hold dear

title: The Bronix Band - Pixelated Ponies EP - 02 At The Gala (8-Bit)
Phoenix, Rise!
description:
Well, I was going to write a brony power metal anthem that talked about friendship and love and sticking together in the face of adversity (or the season finale), but then it turned into this thing. Have a song about dying birds and sad pony princesses and things!

LYRICS:

In the ruins of the castle in the woods
Burned down to the ground where I stood
I cried

I sank to my knees and wept
Cold, lonely, poor and spent
"How I tried..."

And from the depths of doubt
A voice cried out,

"Phoenix, rise!"

I looked up and the phoenix was there
Bright, lustrous, gold and fair
And I sighed

And I watched as the phoenix grew old
Burned down to the ashes cold
And I hide

And back from the ashes came
That bird of flame

Phoenix, rise!

In time built a castle in the clouds
Standing tall and proud
I still cry

I count the seasons come and gone
I look back and I never move on
And I sigh

But when the phoenix sings
My spirit rings,

"Phoenix, rise!"

title: The Pony [a song from "Fallout: Equestria - Project Horizons"]
description:
BEWARE!  THIS SONG CONTAINS ME SINGING!!!  YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!

Say what you will about Somber and his massive book, "Project Horizons," but it's given me a lot of enjoyment over the past several months.  The characters are vivid and the backstory is DEEP.

This is my take on one of the songs written into the book.  The lyrics, as far as I know, are a parody of William Blake's "The Tiger" done up by Somber.  I made slight adjustments to the lyrics and arrangement.  I also made the musics.  The female voice is once again, Metal-Mare.

YouTube: http://youtu.be/cZQzUziy1jY

Download: http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?6kismx8fros11mb
Download the vinyl-ish version (for you lo-fi lovers): http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?05hshpawuhdh94k

Fallout: Equestria by Kkat, the story that started it all: http://www.equestriadaily.com/2011/04/story-fallout-equestria.html
Fallout: Equestria - Project Horizons by Somber: http://www.equestriadaily.com/2011/08/fallout-equestria-project-horizons.html

Lyrics:

The Pony

Pony, Pony, rage resound
In the stable underground,
What immortal horn or hoof
Could frame thy fearful symmetry?

In what fallen city or land
Did your spirit break so grand?
How much pain did you endure
To protect and life secure?

And what friends and what love
Could lift your heart up above?
And when your tears began to fall,
What dread sorrow held you in thrall?

What the shotgun? What the flame?
In what torment birth your shame?
That the rifle? What dread eye
Guides your bullets as they fly?

When your guns and pistols roar
And promise doom and death in store
Do you smile, your work to see?
Do you kill, to be set free?

title: Lenich & Kirya — Pinkie's Brew Russian Gypsy Jazz
description:
You can do anything you want with the song, except sell it.

***

Translated by dəep (http://www.youtube.com/user/eglarionly)
Vocals and Music by Lenich and Kirya
Original song: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=682pneYoP0c

MP3: http://www.mediafire.com/?ja5n98yagtakdgf
FLAC: http://www.mediafire.com/?2d7y39e2qzt0q7w
MP3 (Without Vocals): http://www.mediafire.com/?iz2a2pszdp8b9fb
BACKGROUND PIC: http://i.imgur.com/rkvtN.png

TABS: http://lenich.ucoz.ru/pbrew-tab/index.html

***

Translit (phonetic): http://notepad.cc/share/G8aFh6e1os
English direct translation: http://notepad.cc/share/YjY4E1gGOr
Original English lyric by SherclopPones: http://notepad.cc/share/SoqrLi6SKq

Я буду печь решение — теперь я знаю как.
У кошки девять жизней, так что две добыть — пустяк!
И у меня есть всё, чтоб сделать временной щербет,
А времени на временные меры просто нет!

Так я колдую по-цыгански,
Лапы тритона, пара слов,
Тут же взбиваю время в креме.
Прыгай, портал готов!

Стейк ню... Ты не бойся, Эпплблум!
Жизнь тебе — не фунт изюма, даже если ты — изюм!
Брось инжира и открытку,

Хлеба с маслом, бреда с красным,
Маринада, шоколада,
Глазировку, раскадровку,
Зреют дрожжи, крекинг позже...

«Пинки, раз ты слышишь это — значит час настал.
Просто отпусти нас и не вздумай печь портал!»
Кипит котёл и варится четвёртая стена!
Добавлю жмых, спасу родных, и счастье будет нам!

Так я колдую по-цыгански! Слёзы поняш и ртутный лом.
Боже, ты мне с колдовством поможешь, и у меня будет дом!

Может когда-нибудь дом...

title: Friendship is Witchcraft - Gypsy Bard
description:
Vocals: Jenny Nicholson
Music: Griffin Lewis, Lenich, Kirya
FiW Episode 7: http://youtu.be/9_f6pDBkNlo

Download:
MP3: http://www.mediafire.com/?bb5lt4h8tqq4d7a

FLAC: http://www.mediafire.com/?cocm3c99imvpar9

Multitrack Stems: 
http://www.mediafire.com/?zqmrhdrzsi40xp4 (.rar 100mb)
You can do anything you want with the song, except sell it.

***

Lyric:

When you're rife with devastation
There's a simple explanation:
You're a toymaker's creation
Trapped inside a crystal ball

And whichever way he tilts it
Know that we must be resilient
We won't let them break our spirits
As we sing this silly song

When I was a little filly, a galloping blaze overtook my city
So they shipped me off to the orphanage. Said, "ditch those roots if you wanna fit in"
So I dug one thousand holes and cut a rug with orphan foals
Memories are blurred, and their faces are obscured, but I still, know the words to this song

When you've bungled all your bangles
And your loved ones have been mangled
Listen to the jingle jangle
Of my gypsy tambourine

'Cause these chords are hypnotizing
And the whole world's harmonizing
So please children stop your crying
And just sing along with me

***

Chords:

Fm, C♯, D♯, G♯

title: Lower the Moon (Metal cover)
description:
This one's been a long time in the making - my band (well, former band at this point), NeighSlayer, wrote this and played it during the Summer Bronycon last year. We planned to record it sometime after that, but we never got around to it and the band kinda just died out. Later on, Lolicide and I formed a new (non-pony) band called Scarlet Soundtrack and while we were working on an album together I got the idea to re-record this song. So here it is, almost a year after its conception (a year and a half if you count all of the earlier versions we played live!)

Original by NotACleverPony
Music by Silent Night (formerly NightColt) and Lolicide (formerly Dethonator)
Lyrics by Silent Night (formerly NightColt)

LYRICS:
Stay awake
Don't go to bed-
Just raise your hooves
And bang your head!

Embrace the darkness
Condemn the light
Never falter-
Protect this night!

So we ride on
And we won't ever lose!
In our pride
We refuse

To Lower the Moon...

Those who slumber
In heresy-
They shall suffer
Our reign to be!

Lonely hours
And silent nights
No more, never!
For this we fight!

So we ride on
And we won't ever lose, no!
In our pride
We refuse

To Lower the Moon...

title: It'll Be OK but It Doesn't Mean Anything - Friendship is Witchcraft versus Alicia Keys
description:
LYRICS

I always wanted my own brother,
and then he showed up at our door.
I didn't question where he came from;
I wasn't lonely anymore!

Soon we did everything together;
he taught me how to fly a kite!
I watched him grow into a stallion,
I watched him sleep in bed at night; it's not creepy!

[Chorus]
I gave you my heart and then you turned around...
The secrets that we shared, the moments that you cared...
I gave you my heart and then you turned around...
We went streaking in the park, skinny dipping after dark...

I gave you my heart and then you turned around...
Depressing melodies, suppressing fantasies...
I gave you my heart and then you turned around...

But then he signed that record label;
a cute quintet of boyish sound!
But now that everybody loves him,
I'm just a face out in the crowd!

I threw myself into my studies
to have the world in my control.
I vaporized the competition;
nobody understands me; it's not evil!

[Chorus]
I gave you my heart and then you turned around...
Romantic pony dreams, they never came to be!
I gave you my heart and then you turned around...
(Twilight, please make this song end, we're a bunch of floating heads!)

Just take it from me, I know you'll come around!
Though the law forbids it, this is kismet!
Say "I do" and seal our souls together!
Voulez-vous, our love will last forever!
Since we're not related, it'll be ok...

[Chorus]
I gave you my heart and then you turned around...
The secrets that we shared, the moments that you cared...
I gave you my heart and then you turned around...
We went streaking in the park, skinny dipping after dark...

I gave you my heart and then you turned around...
Depressing melodies, suppressing fantasies...
I gave you my heart and then you turned around...

I gave you my heart and then you turned around... (I know you'll come around)
(I know you'll come around)
I gave you my heart and then you turned around... (I know you'll come around)
(I know you'll come around)

I gave you my heart and then you turned around...
(I know you'll come around)
I gave you my heart and then you turned around...

So different now from what it seemed,
now life has killed the dream I dreamed...

Created with Audacity
Alicia Keys logos, videos, etc. © RCA Records / RCA Music Group / Sony Music Entertainment
Background for cover art by MLP-Vector-Collabs - http://mlp-vector-collabs.deviantart.com/art/Group-Background-1-300705577
No copyright infringement intended; for entertainment purposes only

title: Scary Monsters and Nice Sprites (Trexoid Remix)
Headcanon
description:
Have you gotten into a heated discussion about unimportant things in cartoons?  Heed the warning in this song.

I wish I had a cool, roughed-up Jamaican voice, but alas.  You'll have to deal with my lullaby voice.

Messed up photoshop done by my wonderful wifey-poo: Metal-Mare.
Pics and such used:
Vice Admiral Horatio Lord Nelson, by Lemuel Francis Abbott
Heavily modified party canon by: http://sircxyrtyx.deviantart.com/art/Party-Cannon-308427946
Graffiti made in: http://www.graffiticreator.net/
I don't know where she picked up that lovely brick wall.

YouTube: http://youtu.be/xFcYirDBU80

Lyrics:

Scoots is an orphan and she cannot fly,
She lives in a cardboard box under Dash's house in the sky.
It seems really cruel to pick on this poor kid.
It's not because she is a brat, it's just something that we did.

Applejack is an orphan, too, but at least this one's seeming true.
Granny Smith takes care of her and little Apple Bloom,
But where are their parents?  What happened anyway?
Big Mac won't talk about it and that is why we say...

Headcanon!  The show's writers are gunning for you.
Headcanon!  They'll ruin you, that's what they're gonna do.
Headcanon!  Oh yeah!
You may think it's fun but your headcanon might make it worse for everyone.

You know, Lyra and Bon Bon hook up Friday nights,
And you cannot mention Cheerilee without getting in a fight.
Tavi and Skratch do not date in my mind.  I guess I've made a mortal sin,
But when Derpy ships with a mailbox it's a fight no one can win.


Headcanon!  The show's writers are gunning for you.
Headcanon!  They'll ruin you, that's what they're gonna do.
Headcanon!  Oh yeah!
You may think it's fun but your headcanon might blow it for everyone.

Relax and just let it flow.
Have fun; it's a silly show.
Keep it to yourself; you don't need to share.
There's no such thing as a Ministry Mare!


Headcanon!  The show's writers are gunning for you.
Headcanon!  They'll ruin you, that's what they're gonna do.
Headcanon!  Oh yeah!
Even I think it's fun, but don't let your headcanon screw it up for everyone.

title: For The New Lunar Republic
description:
Part of our first album ~ M O O N ~

The intro of the show was an inspiration source for these arrangements of NACP Luna EP.


Ah... the battle theme.

To be honest, I always found a bit weird how everyone portraits the battle of Night Mare Moon vs Celestia as an army vs army thing.

In my mind it's just a "one night" battle. Why? because it was one night since Night Mare Moon refused to lower The Moon right? So as Celestia felt that something was happening to her turn to rise The Sun she took action ASAP.

(If anyone out there knows about Touhou, you will notice it's similar to the events of the 8th game)

But that's just me.

This one is a bit tricky: It starts as a confrontational theme and goes to Celestia's side at the end, when she you realizes there's no other way but fight against her sister.

description:
Track #3 of my MLP Metal Album: Dethurge. 
My submission to the "Rainbow Dash Remix Competition" by AcousticBrony. 

I had a lot of fun writing and mixing this song. Though, it may be too different to not qualify as an entry to the competition. If that's the case, I'm alright with that.

Feel it! 
Rainbow Thrash 
Unleash it!

Rainbow Thrash

Rainbow Thrash 
Unleash it! 
Rainbow Thrash

Rainbow Thrash 
Yeah!

title: Tartarus
description:
Toastbeard entry! The theme?

"Gates of Tartarus," because Tartarus is canon o.o

I had alot of fun with this one! A special thanks to cfx for lending me some really great advice and awesome choirs!

Oh, I suppose you want to know what I'm saying:

Before harmony, before chaos...

...there was darkness, Proliferated by those things.

No one knows where they came from.

They are ancient, seemingly eternal.

They've been since locked away in the fires of Tartarus, where they belong.

No evil, no walk of life, would dare unlock those gates, not even the lord of chaos himself.

Unbeknownst to the populace, the gates of Tartarus will open once more

The prophecy, written in the blood of an Alicorn.

Yay poetry~ (not)

title: Flim and Flam's Monster
description:
Oh I made this song for toastbeard a week ago or so. Theme was about a steampunk robot.

lol rap

Lyrics:
Flam: Why hello brother Flim! 
Flim: Why hello brother Flam! 
Narrator: It's grand day for the brothers Flim and Flam. 
Flam: Say brother, I've got an idea! 
Flim: An Idea you say? What must that convey? 
Flam: We shall build a machine! 
Flim: A machine? Of what sort? 
Flam: It will be a new invention. 
Narrator: Flam duely retorts. 
Flam: It shall be a rebuttal for all of our failures. 
Flim: I like the sound of this, please brother tell me more! 
Narrator: The brothers wisper quietly and crowd into their workshop 
Little do they know what's about to unfold. 
A mechanical monster, capable of great destruction. 
Unleashed on a world with out mercy or a soul.

Narrator: The brothers worked harder and harder every night . 
Fueled by the inevitable product of their spite. 
Hatred and revenge were their ultimate goals, 
and soon would they achieve this without needing to be told 
Whether this was right or wrong, it didn't matter. 
What mattered was, that the brothers would destroy the laughter. 
Caused by their silly defeats, starting with the nearest town, Ponyville....

Chiptunes about lazer cannon Derpy. I made this song for toastbeard (surprise surprise), and I decided to try my hand at making a chiptune. Overall I'm pleased with the sound, and I broke some rules of chiptunes while I was at it. Have fun!

title: Ponyville 1997
description:
And suddenly, out of nowhere, another 80's sounding track! I promise, last one!

Anyways this is a Toastbeard WAT compo entry! This is pretty much an homage to "Escape from New York," hence "1997" since that is when it took place. The compo was all about using just drums and one certain vst, Arturia's Minimoog V! This was so much fun!!

title: Fallout Equestria
description:
I did this for toastbeard, theme is ponies and video games. This song is heavily inspired from me playing Fallout and listening to post-rock, so I thought I'd try my hand at making a song like that. You know, this is far from perfect. Some of you will like this and some of you will absolutely hate this. I don't really know how to play the guitar, I more or less winged it. I know nothing of musical theory in this area. My mixing and mastering is far from acceptable for a professional (dare I say post)-rock song This is a messy track, its dissonant, sometimes off, but I like it. And that's what my music is about. Enough emotional rambling, I hope you enjoy this song :)

Lyrics:

Time goes by, like a whisper all across the space
between me, and you, falling down forever more,

I can't stand to see you falling down, here.
You're precious to me, in time. In time.


Day by day, a familiar hoof touches my face
wipes away, the tears you have brought to memory, today

The last time I saw you here I saw I lost
a piece of me, inside, inside


Here. I. am. I will, find the way home.

I regret past sins, now gone...

title: Freewave + Dreamsong - Celestia's Ballad (Transformation Remix)
description: This was an wonderful collab and it was so much fun to work with Dreamsong on this. She did a fantastic job on all the vocals and spoken parts (and wrote them too). This is the third of my Twilogy (doh) about our new alicorn princess and another show remix from the finale. So if I've Got to Find a Way was the fandom's reaction with sadness, The Professor was try to get our head to accept why this happened, and then this track is ultimately about happiness and acceptance with that decision (she deserved that promotion!!). Anyway that's the thought. This is the first part of MANY songs that Dreamsong and i are collaborating on with each other! In fact it's expanded to a fourth eventual album done between the both of us.

thnx 4 listenin'

i love uuuu

title: Freewave + Dreamsong - King Sombra
description: I thought Sombra needed a dramatic theme song and this ponfied version of James Bond's Goldfinger came from that. Hoping that we might see a Twilight / Sombra rematch in season 4 as they only hinted at how  scary a villain he could be. Although despite what's in this pmv i think Twi would ultimately defeat him. This also is a bit of a James Bond tribute (50 years woohoo) as we both love Shirley Bassey, John Barry, and the music catalog of that series.  So enjoy this crossover (and go see Skyfall it's great). Hopefully this mix of orchestral, hip-hop, and rock satisfies everyone. Dreamsong was AMAZING on this track and did fantastic vocals and wonderful flute work and we're working on a joint album of ponified covers together (collabs and solo). It's just been a blast working with someone around my age, who's so talented, and easy to get along with.

title: Freewave - I've Got to Find a Way (Dream House Remix)
description: Whether you see this song as Twi's reaction to causing her friend's harm, the reaction of her friend's to her impeding departure, or the fanbase's reaction to all things Twicorn here's my remix of a great melancholy song from the finale. I spent a bit of time the last 2 days trying to make a dream house cover and pmv for it so hope you enjoy it as I haven't put together a track "quickly" in a long time (altogether about 10 hrs). Luckily EQD spotlighted and tacked on as a bonus track track to my U+I album as I was a little saddened that i didn't have a new track or much of a draw to get people to download it. It's success was a big mental and creative boost.

title: Freewave - The Professor (Explains the Science Behind Alicorns)
description: I did a hip-hop track with some rap myself? Tis true!! While many questions have been asked by the brony community about Twilicorn, the Professor Pony gets to the bottom of them all in one of his fabulous rap lectures. All the music samples were hunted down from the original records and not from sample packs (like back in the day). I know this is left field from me but as always i like to try a bity of everything and i think this turned out well and showed off my love for sampling.

title: Aftermath
description:
Anyways; this whole song is based on war. Mainly, the war between ponies and gryphons. Not only the gruesome war itself, but the aftermath and the result of the battles. The everlasting scars, the people they will never see again and the tragedy of the whole thing. I wanted it all to be represented in this song. Sadness, darkness but also hope. Just because everything is in chaos, and it feels like the world is at its end, there is always hope at the end of the tunnel. No matter what happens, keep up the spirit. 
Even after a long and gruesome war, there is time to rebuild.

While I wish I could have done much more with the remix if i had a midi or stems I was able to give the original a remix which turned into into a deep house track. title: As The Neon Rain Fell
description:
Time for a new one!

This one is a song that I've wanted to do for quite a while.
What if you took Ponyville, mixed it with Noir and made music for it? What if the cheerful Ponyville
instead was replaced with a dark city, filled with fame, glory, crime, romance and detectives.

Tried to make it rather smooth and slightly sexy but still keeping it a bit classy 
and harmonic. 


This one was really fun to make, and I hope you enjoy it.

Thought it would be fun to do a playful pun and a Jazz-Funk cover off of C&C Music Factory's - Sweat (Everybody Dance Now). There's not enough pony funk yet (or many retro song nods) so hopefully see this is as fun and a bit of something different for people.

Happy Hearth's Warming Eve, guys.  Here's my Christmas gift to you all, I hope you enjoy it!  I had so much fun working on this, I hope to bring you new music more frequently in 2014!  Now if only I could just get over it and write some lyrics/sing.  

Until next time, keep being amazing and thank you as always for listening, commenting, and subscribing!  Much love for you all!

title: Woodland Winter Wishes
description:
[i]The rain is gone and the sun is out
Shining down on a white powdered route
Through frost filled forests, forever free
Beaming down on me

The light then dims as snow begin to fall
a shining blanket covering all
Frosty breath and icy nose
Silently it snows

The land awakens to the first snow of the year
You can hear the childrens glee even from here
Dreams of a world in wonderous white
like a diamond, shining bright.

They laugh and dance and sing and care not for a thing
Hurled up in cosy clothes, feeding bread crums to the crows
A castle made of snow that almost seem to glow
It's hearths eve feels all around

I watch from a distance as they play
Accompanied by a lone bluejay
But I smile and I feel no dismay
I know I'm warmly welcome to stay![/i]

title: Who I Am
description:
There's a little bit of a story behind this song, so please bear with me.

A few months ago I heard a terrific song by the inimitable DrDycer, about probably the most famous and well-written alicorn OC to ever grace the My Little Pony fandom, Nyx from Pen Stroke's "Past Sins". To me, though, DrDycer's song sounded like the unplugged acoustic version of some epic metal tune, and I felt compelled to create my own version.

Originally I had another singer lined up to do the vocals for this, but due to various circumstances she's been unable to record it. So after having this recording sit around on my computer for a few months I decided to have a go at singing it myself ... well turns out it's just slightly out of my comfortable vocal range so I'm not 100% happy with it, but perhaps some of you will enjoy this song anyway.

Trivia: I think this was actually the first song I recorded on my 7-string, before I'd gotten proper strings for it. (I had a bass string standing in for the low A. The ball stuck out the back of the guitar and looked ridiculous.)

Words and music by DrDycer. His original version: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rEXbOfCWakE.
"Past Sins" by Pen Stroke: http://www.fimfiction.net/story/41596/past-sins
Cover art: http://taionafan369.deviantart.com/art/Nyx-srs-Face-True-Vector-323840893

It's been quite a long time guys. It's been over a month since my last song.

space battle between ponies, and aliens. (In this case, Changelings)

title: Blackened Empire (Original Mix)
description:
HELP THORINAIR BUY NEW STUDIO SPEAKERS:
Buy it on Bandcamp: http://thorinair.bandcamp.com/album/blackened-empire
Donate directly: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1739027/Donate/donate.html

MP3 320 kbps Original Mix download: http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?t71xa1wx4v6cxpw
MP3 320 kbps Club Mix download: http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?rvmdxs94rbp9nrx
WAV 1411 kbps Original Mix download (zip): http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?j0a13k9krnii54a
WAV 1411 kbps Club Mix download (zip): http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?bxta6k6bj67b0f1
Cover Art download: http://www.mediafire.com/view/?qoldvfafemh91e7
Remix Stems download (zip): http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?xu1w530a503nbja

YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/user/Thorinair
SoundCloud: http://soundcloud.com/thorinair
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Thorinair-Music/181104641974397
deviantART: http://thorinair.deviantart.com/
Tumblr: http://thorinair-music.tumblr.com/
iBrony: http://www.ibrony.com/index.php?do=/Thorinair/
Twitter: http://twitter.com/thorinair_music


How was life in the Crystal Empire during King Sombra's reign? Dark, cold, sad... Everypony lived in fear of the dark ruler, living as slaves.

"Blackened Empire" was inspired by these thoughts. It recreates the life of ponies living under Sombra's rule, and also shows it from his own perspective.

The track is heavily contrasted with sad orchestral breaks and dark, aggressive bass sections.

There are both the Original Mix and the Club Mix available for your listening pleasure. Original Mix has a moody orchestral intro, while the Club Mix is more suited towards DJs, having a clubby intro.


I haven't released anything new in months, was trying to perfect this one the whole time. I started working on it back when Season 3 aired with some breaks in production, trying to find what works best. I hope it was worth it in the end, sorry for the huge delay.

I've been trying to purchase a pair of studio monitors I'm after, however it's going slowly as my only source of income at the moment are donations... I would like to thank everyone who has donated so far!


Track mastered by HMage: http://www.youtube.com/user/HMageD

The amazing picture used in the cover art was made by :iconcmaggot:. You should definitely go check out his work!

title: Mission Implausible Theme
description:
"One is a cellist playing at Canterlot's most elite parties. The other is a DJ-for-hire looking to make the big time. Both are secret agents. And together they'll team up to take down a powerful baked goods cartel."

This one was inspired by John Perry's fanfic "Mission: Implausible", featuring everyone's favourite musician ponies as secret agents. Also an excuse for me to pretend to be Monty Norman and write a big band tune. The song turned out about 1000% funkier than I expected though. (Another bonus is I now know how to do dubstep-style wobble bass.)

Read "Mission: Implausible" here: http://www.fimfiction.net/story/44000/mission-implausible
Cover art from Gen-Jack-Oneill: http://gen-jack-oneill.deviantart.com/art/We-re-Getting-the-Band-Back-Together-289408459

Just a warning for my regular listeners: this is pretty different from what you've probably heard from me before, it's not metal, not even close!

title: A Symphonic Metal Tribute to A Canterlot Wedding
description:
To celebrate the beginning of Season 3 of My Little Pony, The L-Train proudly presents: A Symphonic Metal Tribute to "A Canterlot Wedding!" This is my homage to the wonderful music from MLP's most ambitious episode yet, the Season 2 finale.

So a while ago I recorded a Symphonic Metal Tribute to My Little Pony ... some of you may have heard it :) But I only included the songs from Season 1, and lots of you have been asking "when is Season 2?" And I started working through the season 2 songs, sorting out what would work and what songs could go together ... and once I tallied up that songs on the "must include" list I had about 25 minutes worth of music! So I've concentrated on what I though was the best part of the season, musically, which was all the wonderful music from the finale. Enjoy!

All guitars, bass, drum programming and orchestral programming / arrangements by me (The L-Train). All music written by Daniel Ingram and William Anderson. My Little Pony is owned by Hasbro.

title: Cadence's Theme
description:
Also known as "Twilight and Cadence" or "Sunshine and Ladybugs".

This is sort of an outtake from A Symphonic Metal Tribute to A Canterlot Wedding; I was originally going to include this piece there, but I couldn't fit it in and still have the whole thing flow properly ... but it's a wonderful bit of music so I've extended it slightly and recorded it for you all! Enjoy!

All guitars, bass, drum programming and orchestral programming / arrangements by me (The L-Train). Music by William Anderson (mostly!). My Little Pony is owned by Hasbro.

title: The Moon Rises
description:
An epic metal cover of Ponyphonic 's "The Moon Rises".

I loved Ponyphonic's work on this song, it's very dramatic and operatic, but I couldn't help thinking "this needs a wicked guitar solo in it". So I recorded a cover version, with a guitar solo. And then I decided to try singing it, because it's an incredibly fun song to sing (as almost all villainous songs are!).

This is also the first thing I've recorded since replacing the pickups in my guitar with DiMarzios, and also since getting a copy of EWQL's Symphonic Choirs, which is more fun than it has any right to be...

All lead vocals, guitars, bass, drum programming, orchestral programming and choir programming by me (The L-Train). Music written by Ponyphonic of course, and Luna / Nightmare Moon and MLP:FiM is owned by Hasbro.

Original song: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kPjVCIX5Fvs
Karaoke version: https://eqbeats.org/track/4872

title: "Become The Solrac" : Official Rotlcon Anthem
description:
On October 31st, Nightmare Night, I will be at The Running of The Leaves Convention, DJ'ing for the Rave they're having on that night. I made this anthem for Solrac because he is the guest of honor over there. Can't wait to show him my song for him live.

Highly inspired by Zatox's, "Check Out The Drop" , I did the best I could to try to re-create this awesome song in FL Studio 11, and turn it into the most-go hard, Defcon Pinkie Anthem ever.

And it worked. Rotlcon 10-31-13.


@Tokyo Magika Productions 2013.

title: Dr. Dycer. - Lazy Applejack feat. Buffalo and Isegrimism
description:
Open description for links~
Attention: I did the description a bit different this time, so read all of it!




Backstory:
Before Applebloom was born, Applejack had a reputation of being lazy. Applejack loved skipping out on work and either sleeping, or walking around, in and out of town. She learns how to work hard for her family when she has to take care of others besides herself. I guess this also explains why the clubhouse was so rundown when Applejack gave it to the CMC: It was her former hideout to get away from work, but since Applebloom was born, had gone out of use and out of repair. Yey, I made headcanon~

title: For Twilight (Trixie'sSong)
description:
It had been nearly a year since the Alicorn Amulet incident when Twilight, on official business to outlying areas of Equestria, found Trixie alone and destitute.  Life had not been kind to the show-mare; time and time again, she had rebuilt her wagon and tried to resume performances, but word seemed to have spread.  In every town she had been met with at least as much avarice as she had at that fateful show, years ago in Ponyville.

When Twilight Sparkle stumbled upon her, “The Great and Powerful Trixie” was so broken inside, she didn't even have the energy to lash-out at the one she felt had been the beginning of her downfall.  A simple, lifeless “Hi” was all she could manage.

However, this one word, “Hi,” had real magic within it... not magic to vanquish foes... not show-stopping magic... but rather the magic of friendship.

Sending Spike on to complete the rounds, Twilight stayed with Trixie; sharing her campfire and the tarp that had once been a resplendent proscenium.  

Twilight helped Trixie to see that the magic Trixie herself possessed was not intended for the same purposes as her own – saving villages, empires and the like.  But even so, Trixie's gift for magic was in fact just as valuable; for it could be used to lift spirits and inspire hope.  Trixie's magic was the kind of magic that could entertain, surprise and enchant... woven well, it was the kind of magic that could encourage greatness _within_others._

Twilight stayed with Trixie in the little clearing; listening, sharing, and helping Trixie to create a show that focused on bringing out the best in the pony volunteers from an audience.

Trixie was secretly terrified to go in in front of another audience, but with Twilight's gentle encouragement, the first performance of this new act was the best Trixie could ever remember.  The hoofstomps and cheers as she took her last bow were positively thunderous.  And there was Twilight, her friend, right there in the front row beaming up at her with tears in her beautiful violet eyes.

Now the campfire burns low next to the two friends asleep in the little clearing, and Trixie wakes from a pleasant dream....


What a dream I had
of us in Ponyville...
things were different,
'cause you cared for me still;
like you do right now.

I wandered empty streets down
past the shop-displays;
I heard the clock-tower bell
ringing down the alleyway,
as I walked on.

And when you ran to me,
your coat damp with the night;
we  walked on frosted fields
of juniper and lamplight.
...You held my hoof.

And when I awoke
and felt you warm and near,
I kissed your smoky mane
with my grateful tears.
Oh I love you, mare.
Oh I love you.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
“For Twilight (Trixie's Song)” - a parody of “For Emily” by Simon and Garfunkel
words and vocals by Amadhia “Dreamsong”

My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic, all canon characters, locations and their likenesses are (c) Hasbro.
Used for the intent of promoting the enjoyment of the animated series.
“For Emily, Wherever I May Find Her” MIDI sequenced by Michael D MacDonald

title: Just Live Featuring Orion Melody
description:
Download https://eqbeats.org/track/4945/mp3

Lyrics https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xWYsIJvKE42j5GNNUHNOYM5hhO7Q84oR2y-rj0vbncc/edit

Orion Melody's Channel http://www.youtube.com/user/aWolfNamedOrion

Art work done by Kaca DragonFly for my birthday! FOLLOW HER TUMBLR NOW! http://askdragonfly.tumblr.com/ DO IT!


Honestly i feel like thsi should be a sub special

Backstory of the song
This song is actually a few things. The first verse is actually about brony rappers that look down at what they do. It was me saying that no matter what it's about if you have the skill you have the skill. It's that simple. What you're doing maybe different or wierd but that just means it's unique!
The second verse and third verse's were both directed at me on the other hand. The second being about the performance i have coming up and how i'm actually nervous due to the content of what i'm performing. The third verse is asking myself what i'm gonna do about it. ending the verse by saying i'm going to live. 

This is the song that is planned to end my set for my performance on the 27th so i felt the last verse i should try and get the audience involved as well! This is one of my favorite songs i've done amazing for fans of MLP and non!

To my fans (Or haters) thank you! You all made every verse i've ever rapped worth it! To my friends, you helped make this a AMAZING roller coaster that i had the chance to hop on. All the ups and downs that it's put us through, they were fun and we can look back at them and laugh! So where it takes me  or any of us may still be a mystery but i have a feeling that we're all gonna enjoy it. 

Finally to Orion! You and me HAVE to do another collab in the future! You're fucking amazing and without you this song wouldn't be NEAR as good as it is right now!

Follow me at Twitter https://twitter.com/Versal17

Tumblr http://versal-chronic.tumblr.com/

EQB https://eqbeats.org/user/340

title: Babs Seed (Extended Rock Cover) feat. Warbalist
description:
"Babs Seed (Rock Cover)"
by 0neTr1ckP0ny

Guest musician:
Warbalist - Lead guitar
http://www.youtube.com/user/warbalist

To be honest, I never thought that I would end up doing this song. I remember seeing the episode it was in and just thinking that it's already close enough to rock, so what was I going to do with it? I'd end up with a song too close to the original.

But there are two major problems: 1) The song *really* catchy. (2) I suddenly had some interesting ideas about how to restructure the song to extend it, and for some vocal arrangements. I ended up with this; the first half of the song pretty much sticks to the original, than it goes off the deep end. So I think we can look at it this way: this song was less about changing the arrangement and the style of the song, and more about seeing how many vocal tracks you can pile on top of each other before it turns into pure cacophony.

I might actually post a screencap of the vocal tracks on Tumblr, just for a laugh, so keep an eye on that. (Shameless plug? Me!? Never!)

Big thanks go to Warbalist for playing lead guitar on the track and pretty much knocking it out of the park. Go check out his channel (http://www.youtube.com/user/warbalist)!

Have a question? Check out my Tumblr at http://0netr1ckp0nymusic.tumblr.com/

title: Assertive Fluttershy - Boooring! (Sonic Rainboom Mix)
description:
And suddenly, epic trance remix. I had Assertive Fluttershy's melody stuck in my head a couple days ago, and I looked around to see that no one had really done a full-fledged, proper length epic trance remix of the track. I decided that simply wouldn't do, and got to work on this one. Synesthesia (Fly Away), by The Thrillseekers, was a big inspiration for the synth line, incidentally.

Original: 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xJY6T2MdBmI

Many thanks (as always) to mlptf2mods.com for having all of the vocal only stuff I could ever need.
http://www.mlptf2mods.com/create/reference-materials
